item.title: PSE trading delayed on Monday, traders cite technical issues - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
PSE trading delayed on Monday, traders cite technical issues  ABS-CBN News

The bourse opened at around 10:15 a.m. Trading was scheduled to start at 9:30 a.m..

item.title: PSE index extends gains as Xi starts visit to PHL - BusinessWorld Online
item.description:
PSE index extends gains as Xi starts visit to PHL  BusinessWorld Online

By Arra B. Francia, Reporter. THE MAIN INDEX extended its gains on Tuesday, as investors focused on Chinese President Xi Jinping's visit to the country.

item.title: Lopez Holdings marks 25th anniversary on PSE - ABS-CBN News
item.description:
Lopez Holdings marks 25th anniversary on PSE  ABS-CBN News

The conglomerate includes broadcaster ABS-CBN Corp, SkyCable, First Gen Corp, Rockwell Land, First Industrial Park and First Philippine Holdings Corp.

item.title: PSE index climbs on MSCI, oil tax hike suspension - BusinessWorld Online
item.description:
PSE index climbs on MSCI, oil tax hike suspension  BusinessWorld Online

LOCAL SHARES rose Wednesday amid the country's increase in the MSCI Index's review as well as the temporary oil tax hike suspension next year. The local ...

item.title: Business Nightly: Asian markets extend decline ahead of OPEC meeting - ABS CBN News
item.description:
Business Nightly: Asian markets extend decline ahead of OPEC meeting  ABS CBN News

The Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries' (OPEC) expected production cuts is also affecting local market sentiment, as Philippine shares joined the wide-scale sell-off. item.title: Unicapital Group seals partnership with KTB Securities Thailand - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Unicapital Group seals partnership with KTB Securities Thailand  SunStar Philippines

UNICAPITAL Group, one of the leading investment houses in the Philippines, signed a memorandum of understanding (MOU) with KTB Securities (Thailand) Public Company Limited (KTBST) to expand market collaborations between Thai and Philippine investors in investment banking and investing in the stock market. The partnership focuses on three possible areas involving: public fund-raising transactions from institutional clients in the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) and the Stock Exchange of Thailand (SET), including equity stocks, fixed income, and mutual funds; dual-listing on the PSE and SET; ...

item.title: Traders anticipate Santa Claus rally as PH stocks surge past 7,500 - Rappler
item.description:
Traders anticipate Santa Claus rally as PH stocks surge past 7,500  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) broke past crucial resistance level and closed above 7,500 on Monday, December 3, hinting at a Santa Claus rally or a rise in stock prices in December. The PSEi closed at 7,532.9, 2.24% on Monday, 165.05 points higher than the previous close. Volume turnover was at 1.49 billion shares valued at P10.22 billion. Foreign buying was at P6.56 billion, while foreign selling hit P6.68 billion. The most active stocks were Metrobank (3.02%), Ayala Land (0.65%), SM Prime Holdings (5.19%), Aboitiz Power (4.42%), and BDO Unibank (2.3%). A...

item.title: Lopez Holdings marks 25th anniversary on PSE - ABS CBN News
item.description:
ABS CBN News

Happening now: 25th Listing Anniversary celebration of Lopez Holdings Corporation pic.twitter.com/4kak1CNsdh — Phil. Stock Exchange (@PhStockExchange) November 26, 2018 MANILA -- Lopez Holdings marked its 25th listing anniversary at the Philippine Stock Exchange on Monday with top officials ringing the opening bell to kick off the trading week. The conglomerate includes broadcaster ABS-CBN Corp, SkyCable, First Gen Corp, Rockwell Land, First Industrial Park and First Philippine Holdings Corp. Lopez Holdings chairman and CEO Manolo Lopez attended the program at the PSE trading floor. Lopez H...

item.title: PSE withdraws PCC notification on PDS merger, to refile soon - Rappler
item.description:
PSE withdraws PCC notification on PDS merger, to refile soon  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange Incorporated (PSE) has initially withdrawn its application to the Philippine Competition Commission (PCC) for its planned P2-billion merger with the bond market operator Philippine Dealing System Holdings Corporation (PDS), in order to complete the information required by the anti-trust body. Once it completes the information on future operations, PCC Commissioner Johannes Bernabe said PSE will refile its PDS merger notification before his office as soon as possible. (READ: How PH's top antitrust official is guarding market competition) "W...

item.title: PH stocks break 8,200 level, post 3rd straight all-time high - Rappler
item.description:
PH stocks break 8,200 level, post 3rd straight all-time high  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Local stocks are ending the ghost month with a bang, breaching the 8,200 mark and reaching a new all-time high for the 3rd straight trading session on Monday, September 18, as they cheer the US markets' record high. On Monday, the Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) closed at a record high of 8,294.14, up by 113.29 points or 1.4% from Friday, September 15. The PSEi's closing level of 8,294.14 is also a new all-time intraday high for the index. "Shares continued their upward trajectory as an important trading week sees the end of the ghost month and the meeting of se...

item.title: PSEI treks to new high for the year - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PSEI treks to new high for the year  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) trekked to its highest level for the year as it closed at 8,037.51 points, up by 65.79 points or 0.8 percent. Yesterday’s closing level was the highest for the index since Aug. 10, 2016 when it closed at 8,051.40 points. All six sectoral indices also chalked up gains. The property sector was up the most as it rose 1.7 percent. Year-to-date, the PSEi has surged by 17.5 percent. (PR)

item.title: To save the firm, Calata to sell out to Millennium Global - Rappler
item.description:
To save the firm, Calata to sell out to Millennium Global  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Calata Corporation plans to spin off its assets and sell an 81% stake in the company to Millennium Global Holdings Incorporated – a move that might save the agriculture firm from being delisted from the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) and protect shareholders' interest. Calata president Joseph Calata said in a message to shareholders that the company's board of directors approved these transactions in a bid to protect the welfare of its minority shareholders. This was after the PSE initiated a delisting procedure against the company because of multiple disclosure viola...

item.title: PSE index breaches 8,300-mark - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PSE index breaches 8,300-mark  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) breached the 8,300 level and rose to a fresh all-time intraday high of 8,321.81. At the close of yesterday trading, the PSEi was at 8,286.86, up by 67.54 points or 0.8 percent from Wednesday’s close. All sectoral indices also ended higher with the Holding Firms and Industrial counters up the most, gaining 1.3 percent and 1.0 percent respectively. Year to date, the PSEi has gained 21.1 percent. (PR)

item.title: Hans Sicat is new ING Bank country manager - Rappler
item.description:
Hans Sicat is new ING Bank country manager  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Former Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) chief Hans Sicat will be the new head of the local unit of Dutch giant ING Bank N.V. come mid-August. ING Bank on Monday, July 24 announced that Consuelo "Zondy" Garcia will retire as country manager and head of clients of ING’s Manila Branch, effective November 16, 2017. Its board appointed Sicat as her successor who will join the bank mid-August to ensure smooth transition. Sicat headed the PSE for 6 years until May 2017. He brings with him more than two decades of experience as an investment banker, having worked for Citigroup ...

item.title: SM wants to buy into Goldilocks - Rappler
item.description:
SM wants to buy into Goldilocks  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – SM Investments Corporation, the listed conglomerate of the Philippines' richest man Henry Sy Sr, confirmed that it plans to buy into Goldilocks Bakeshop Incorporated, the largest bakeshop chain in the Philippines. SM told the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) on Tuesday, August 29, that it is in preliminary talks with Goldilocks Bakeshop for "a possible equity investment, joint venture, or other cooperation agreement." "[T]he said potential investment is pending and subject to regulatory approval by the Philippine Competition Commission (PCC)," SM corporate secretary Elm...

item.title: ALI profit up 18% - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
ALI profit up 18%  Sun.Star Philippines

AYALA Land Inc. (ALI) posted net earnings of P11.5 billion in the first half of the year, up 18 percent from P9.7 billion in the same period in 2016. Consolidated revenues rose 18 percent to P64.5 billion, ALI told the Philippine Stock Exchange. (PR)

item.title: Del Monte pays first dividend for dollar-denominated shares - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Del Monte pays first dividend for dollar-denominated shares  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, October 9) -- Del Monte Pacific Ltd. began paying investors the first dividend from the company's dollar-denominated preferred shares. Investors will enjoy a yield of 6.625% per annum, equivalent to roughly $0.33 per share, for the period April to October, Del Monte said in a statement issued Monday. "In addition to the coupon rate, investors who plan to convert (their dividend) to Philippine peso also benefit from the appreciation of the U.S. dollar," it said. The exchange rate was P50.17 to a dollar when the food giant issued its dollar-denominated shares on...

item.title: New milestone as Philippine stocks breach 8,300 mark - Rappler
item.description:
New milestone as Philippine stocks breach 8,300 mark  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) continued its rally and achieved another new record on Thursday, September 21, breaching the 8,300 level for the first time. This came as investors mainly reacted to the US Federal Reserve's expectation that it would raise rates at least one more time before 2017 ends. At the close of Thursday's trading, the PSEi was at 8,286.86 points, up by 67.54 or 0.8% from Wednesday, September 20. All sectoral indices also ended higher with the Holding Firms and Industrial counters up the most, gaining 1.3% and 1%, respectively. The PSEi ...

item.title: PSEi maintains lineup - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PSEi maintains lineup  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) will not see any changes in its composition based on the review covering the trading period from July 2016 to June 2017. The PSEi, which is the Philippine stock market’s main index, is composed of the top 30 stocks that meet the qualifications of being a PSEi-member such as having a public float of at least 12 percent, and having passed the liquidity and market capitalization screening. The six sectoral indices, on the other hand, will have changes in its constituents. Additions The Financials index will see the inclusion of Medco Holdings, Inc. an...

item.title: DoubleDragon plans to sell over P7 billion worth of shares - Rappler
item.description:
DoubleDragon plans to sell over P7 billion worth of shares  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – DoubleDragon Properties Corporation, owned by Mang Inasal founder Edgar "Injap" Sia II and Jollibee chief Tony Tan Caktiong, announced on Monday, August 7, that it plans to raise P7.5 billion through a follow-on offering, in a deal worth more than 6 times its initial public offering (IPO). A follow-on offering refers to the sale of shares of stock that comes after a listed firm has issued an IPO. In April 2014, DoubleDragon raised P1.16 billion from 579.73 million IPO shares priced at P2 apiece. DoubleDragon told the local bourse that it plans to conduct a follow-on of...

item.title: Razon sells 3.18% stake in Bloomberry - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Razon sells 3.18% stake in Bloomberry  Sun.Star Philippines

PRIME Metroline Holdings Inc., the holding company of Enrique K. Razon Jr., chairman and controlling shareholder of Bloomberry Resorts Corp., sold 350 million shares representing 3.18 percent of his stake in the company in an overnight placement. Prime Metroline remains the largest shareholder, with 65.58 percent of the company’s shares outstanding post this transaction. The shares were sold at P10.85 per share, equivalent to approximately P3.8 billion. The shares were placed to international institutional investors at an eight percent discount to the VWAP on Monday. Goldman Sachs (Singapor...

item.title: AboitizPower marks 10th year on PSE - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
AboitizPower marks 10th year on PSE  Sun.Star Philippines

ABOITIZPOWER celebrated its 10th anniversary at the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) on July 18, still focused on pursuing its balanced mix strategy while riding on the country’s economic growth. AboitizPower CEO Erramon I. Aboitiz said the company is on track to reaching its target of reaching 4,000 megawatts (mw) in attributable capacity by 2020 while maintaining a healthy portfolio of renewable energy. “We will continue to push our balanced mix strategy because we believe that the long-term energy security of the country can be solved by balancing sustainability, accessibility, and reliab...

item.title: PSE plans to offer more shares to bring PDS merger closer - Rappler
item.description:
PSE plans to offer more shares to bring PDS merger closer  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange Incorporated (PSE) plans on offering more shares to bring the merger with the Philippine Dealing System Holdings Corporation (PDS) closer to fruition. One of the stumbling blocks in the long-running saga to consolidate the country's equity and fixed income or bond market is the 20% broker ownership in the PSE requirement of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). As such, the PSE plans to offer up to 11.5 million shares to investors to diversify its ownership structure. The exact number of shares, however, is not yet set. "Right now,...

item.title: MGHI board approves Calata acquisition - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
MGHI board approves Calata acquisition  Sun.Star Philippines

MILLENNIUM Global Holdings Inc. (MGHI) will acquire 81 percent of Calata Corp. by subscribing to 2.5 billion shares from the latter’s increase in authorized capital stock, the company said in a disclosure to the Philippine Stock Exchange. The transaction “will enable MGHI to acquire a listed company with a vehicle for its subsidiary, Millennium Ocean Star Corp., to substantially enhance its seafood business.” The transaction is also expected to enhance value over shares held by existing shareholders of both companies. The transaction will be presented for approval during the stockholders’ m...

item.title: Robinsons Retail Holdings to replace EDC on PSEi - Rappler
item.description:
Robinsons Retail Holdings to replace EDC on PSEi  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) announced it will add Robinsons Retail Holdings, Incorporated (RRHI) to its benchmark PSE index (PSEi) to replace Energy Development Corporation (EDC), which will be delisted from the bourse. In a statement on Tuesday, September 26, the PSE said "EDC will be removed from the PSEi as its free float level dropped below the 12% minimum requirement to qualify as a main index constituent." The move will take effect on Thursday, September 28. Gokongwei-led RRHI was listed in November 2013 and will become the 5th stock from the Services sec...

item.title: RRHI unseats EDC from PSE Index - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
RRHI unseats EDC from PSE Index  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange, Inc. (PSE) announced that the Energy Development Corp. (EDC) will be removed from the PSEi as its free float level dropped below the 12 percent minimum requirement to qualify as a main index constituent. EDC will be replaced by Robinsons Retail Holdings, Inc. (RRHI). RRHI, which was listed in November 2013, is the fifth stock from the Services sector that is part of the PSEi. RRHI will be included in the PSEi effective Sept. 28. (PR)

item.title: PSE Index Posts Fresh Record High - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PSE Index Posts Fresh Record High  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) closed the week at another record high, ending Friday’s trading session at 8,180.85, up by 35.94 points or .44 percent from Thursday’s record close of 8,144.91. The All Shares index also closed higher at 4,836.33, up by 20.42 points or 0.42 percent. Five of the six sectoral indices closed in the green, with the property sector posting the biggest gain of 1.3 percent. Value turnover for the day amounted to P11.18 billion, with 1.18 billion shares traded. (PR)

item.title: PSE approves Chelsea IPO application - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PSE approves Chelsea IPO application  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange, Inc. approved the initial public offering (IPO) listing application of Chelsea Logistics Holdings Corp. The shipping company, which will use the ticker symbol CLC, will be offering 546.59 million shares at a maximum price of P14.63 per share. The PSE also approved CLC’s request to increase its allocation for Local Small Investors (LSI) to a maximum allowable subscription amount of P100,000. Typically, under the LSI program, the IPO subscription shall not exceed P25,000. per subscriber. The offer period of Chelsea is scheduled on July 24 to 31, 2017 while its t...

item.title: Search on for outstanding youth organizations - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Search on for outstanding youth organizations  Sun.Star Philippines

THE search is on for the Ten Accomplished Youth Organizations (Tayo) in the country. Now on its 15th year, the search is conducted by the National Youth Commission and the Tayo Awards Foundation Inc. It is open to all groups, organizations, clubs and societies whose membership and leadership are compose of at least five members who are below 30 years old. The project entry to be submitted must be a recently concluded project or an ongoing program and should be under the following categories: culture, arts and heritage; education and technology; environment, disaster risk reduction and clima...

item.title: Doubts hound KPMG following 2GO accounting scandal - Rappler
item.description:
Doubts hound KPMG following 2GO accounting scandal  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The reputation of KPMG RG Manabat & Company, one of the top 5 auditing firms of listed companies, is on the line over alleged inflated financial statements of 2GO Group Incorporated, which are now being investigated by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Other than 2GO, KPMG RG Manabat has also been the auditor of 34 other listed firms – such as San Miguel Corporation – over the last few years. Other firms being audited by KPMG include Asian Terminals Incorporated, Cosco Capital Incorporated, DoubleDragon Properties Corporation, Macay Holdings Incorporated, a...

item.title: PSE to sell common shares to reduce broker ownership - Rappler
item.description:
PSE to sell common shares to reduce broker ownership  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) plans to sell 11.5 million common shares through follow-on offering, which could potentially raise as much as P2.8 billion in fresh capital. In a disclosure on Thursday, July 20, the PSE said its board authorized the issuance of 11.5 million common shares out of the unissued portion of the company's authorized capital stock offered to the public. The share sale is part of the company’s move to reduce to 20% brokers’ ownership in the stock exchange as prescribed under the Securities Regulation Code (SRC). Other details of the share s...

item.title: Investor sentiment still positive - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Investor sentiment still positive  Sun.Star Philippines

INVESTOR sentiment in the stock market remains positive, amid the ongoing war in Marawi City and the government’s bloody anti-drug campaign, a top official of the COL Financial Group said. “We did a survey of our customers in Manila about their outlook of the stock market and outlook on their businesses or jobs. It was surprisingly very high despite the noise,” said Dino Bate, president and CEO of COL Financial in an interview. He said they see this noise is temporary and that these shouldn’t stop Filipinos from investing. “These is noise that are creating opportunities that the market shou...

item.title: August net outflows hit $58M as ghost month begins - Rappler
item.description:
August net outflows hit $58M as ghost month begins  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The onset of ghost month coupled with rising tensions from North Korea's missile tests combined to see hot money leave the country in August. The Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) said on Thursday, September 14, that foreign portfolio investments amounted to $936 million for August 2017. The amount is down by 34.7% from July 2017 and 46.7% from August 2016, which the BSP attributed to a "hesitancy to invest" resulting in think trading due to the traditional ghost month period. The lower investments, coupled with outflows of $994 million, resulted in net outflows of $58...

item.title: Banks, stock trading to continue today - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Banks, stock trading to continue today  Sun.Star Philippines

SAVE for clearing, settlement, cash servicing and treasury operations, other functions of the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas will be suspended today, Gov. Nestor Espenilla said in a memorandum. He said regular reserve day “insofar as computing reserve position” will be observed while all reports due for submission will be received tomorrow without penalty. The Bankers Association of the Philippines announced that all member banks will remain fully operational despite the suspension of work in government offices, including normal check clearing operations, trading and other financial transactio...

item.title: The SGV that Washington SyCip left behind - Rappler
item.description:
The SGV that Washington SyCip left behind  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The oldest accounting firm in the country remains the most sought after by the country's biggest corporations. But the market share of SyCip, Gorres, Velayo & Co. (SGV), the homegrown giant founded by the recently departed business icon Washington SyCip, has been slipping. (READ: Business icon Washington SyCip dies at 96) As of December 2016, SGV audits 54% of the 304 publicly listed firms in the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE). As of 2014 and among the Top 1,000 Corporations compiled by BusinessWorld and previously reported by the defunct Forbes Philippines, SGV's sha...

item.title: Solar files case against ABS-CBN directors, officers - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
Solar files case against ABS-CBN directors, officers  Sun.Star Philippines

SOLAR Entertainment Corp. has filed a complaint for estafa against directors and officers of ABS-CBN. A disclosure filed by ABS-CBN with the Philippine Stock Exchange stated that the case, which was filed before the Office of the City Prosecutor of Makati City, is related to the civil case for damages filed by Solar against ABS-CBN in connection with their joint license agreement for the NBA games. “ABS-CBN believes that the criminal complaint, like the civil complaint has no legal and factual basis, and is being used as a tool for harassment. ABS-CBN will take appropriate legal action to h...

item.title: BIR-Del Monte tax issue: More questions than answers - Rappler
item.description:
BIR-Del Monte tax issue: More questions than answers  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Big questions remain in the controversial tax settlement case between the Bureau of Internal Revenue (BIR) and Del Monte Philippines Incorporated (DMPI). The controversy has necessitated two congressional committee hearings so far, as well as a plunder case against top BIR officials including Commissioner Caesar Dulay. At the heart of the controversy is the BIR’s swift acceptance of a P65.4 million tax settlement from DMPI to account for the firm’s tax deficiencies from 2011 to 2013 which the government agency originally valued at P8.7 billion. The P65.4 million settle...

item.title: CLI to build socialized housing in Bogo City - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CLI to build socialized housing in Bogo City  Sun.Star Philippines

PUBLICLY-LISTED housing developer Cebu Landmasters Inc. (CLI) is set to build 697 houses in northern Cebu. In a disclosure to the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) yesterday, the developer announced that it executed a deed of absolute sale for a 4.6-hectare property in Barangay La Paz in Bogo City amounting to P21.29 million, obtained from its IPO proceeds. “Payment of P 10,643,454.7 or 50 percent down-payment was made upon signing of the deed of absolute sale. The remaining balance will be paid after the land title is transferred in the name of CLI,” the company said. The property will becom...

item.title: PSEI sets new record high - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
PSEI sets new record high  Sun.Star Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) posted a new record high yesterday, closing at 8,144.91, up by 91.03 points or 1.13 percent from Wednesday’s close. Yesterday’s closing level is the highest for the main index since April 10, 2015, when the PSEi closed at 8,127.48. Intraday, the PSEi also hit a fresh all-time intraday high of 8,169.64, surpassing the previous intraday record of 8,136.97 posted on April 7, 2015. “The stock market’s surge to a record high underpins investor confidence in the local economy and in the Philippine capital markets. The Philippines remains a favorite among...

item.title: Chelsea Logistics' final offer price: P10.68 each - Rappler
item.description:
Chelsea Logistics' final offer price: P10.68 each  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Chelsea Logistics Holdings Corporation lowered the price of its initial public offering (IPO) to P10.68 per share, enabling it to raise as much as P5.84 billion in proceeds, according to the underwriter handling the transaction. The final offer price is lower compared to the P14.63 maximum offer price earlier set by the company. BDO Capital and Investments Corporation president Eduardo Francisco said in a text message that at P10.68 per share, the offering will be sufficiently covered and will provide investors an upside. "We have convinced Mr. [Dennis] Uy to give an u...

item.title: CLI purchases 7.2 hectares in CDO - Sun.Star Philippines
item.description:
CLI purchases 7.2 hectares in CDO  Sun.Star Philippines

WITH its thrust to expand outside its home base, Cebu Landmasters purchased a 7.2-hectare property in Cagayan de Oro City for P133 million. The city, now considered as highly urbanized and the 10th most populous in the country, is one of the key sites identified by the company for expansion as stated in the use of IPO proceeds. The property will be developed into a residential project under the Velmiro heights brand, which first established its presence in Cebu in 2013. This will be the second project of CLI in CDO after MesaVerte, a three tower condominium that sold already 95 percent of i...

item.title: #WalangPasok: Gov't offices, courts in Metro Manila, Calabarzon, Central Luzon - Rappler
item.description:
#WalangPasok: Gov't offices, courts in Metro Manila, Calabarzon, Central Luzon  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines (4th UPDATE) – Work in government offices and in courts in Metro Manila, Calabarzon, and Central Luzon was suspended on Tuesday, September 12, due to Tropical Depression Maring. "Upon the recommendation of the NDRRMC (National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council), the Office of the Executive Secretary has announced that work in government offices in Metro Manila, Region III and Calabarzon is hereby suspended," said Presidential Spokesperson Ernesto Abella in a statement early Tuesday morning. The Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA), in a separate statement, sa...

item.title: Chelsea Logistics stock closes in the red on PSE debut - Rappler
item.description:
Chelsea Logistics stock closes in the red on PSE debut  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Shares in Chelsea Logistics Holdings Corporation, the 2nd publicly-traded firm of businessman Dennis Uy, had a bland stock market debut on Tuesday, August 8, as investors continued to take profits after seeing gains early on. On Tuesday, the stock fell below its initial public offering (IPO) price of P10.68 each. It opened at P11.04, rose to P11.22, only to close lower than its IPO price, at P10.56 each. This came against a backdrop of mostly sluggish trading on the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE). Most stock indices ended lower on Tuesday. "Chelsea Logistics' maiden v...

item.title: Philippine stocks post all-time high amid upbeat U.S. market - Rappler
item.description:
Philippine stocks post all-time high amid upbeat U.S. market  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – The Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) braved ghost month as it posted its highest close in history on Thursday, September 14, on the back of the upbeat US market and a "buy" recommendation on local property shares. The PSEi closed at 8,144.91, up by 91.03 points or 1.13% from Wednesday, September 13's close. It was on April 10, 2015 when the PSEi breached the 8,100 level at 8,127.48 points. "Asia is tracking US gains but outperforming region after China data disappointed. [There is also] one foreign broker who released a 'buy' recommendation on Philippine property...

item.title: PSE approves Dennis Uy's Chelsea Logistics IPO - Rappler
item.description:
PSE approves Dennis Uy's Chelsea Logistics IPO  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Dennis Uy's Chelsea Logistics Holdings Corporation will debut in the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) on August 8, after it secured the final approval of the local bourse. The PSE board on Wednesday, July 19, approved the company's offer and sale of 546.59 million new common shares at a maximum price of P14.63 each, or P8 billion in total. "We thank the PSE for believing in the soundness of our business and for recognizing our potential to help accelerate the Philippine economy’s growth by delivering its logistics needs," Uy, Chelsea Logistics founder and chairman, said...

item.title: Of PDRs and 'foreign ownership' of media - Rappler
item.description:
Of PDRs and 'foreign ownership' of media  Rappler

The ownership of Rappler has been catapulted into a national issue. Upping the ante on Wednesday, July 26, Manila Times columnist Rigoberto Tiglao proposed that Rappler personnel should be jailed for up to 21 years for violating our Securities Regulation Code (SRC). Intenseful! If Tiglao’s claims are true, these have severe implications for our entrepreneurs and nascent venture capital and private equity investors. What the hell are PDRs? The debate revolves around Philippine Depository Receipts or PDRs, which Rappler sold to two foreign investors in 2015. These are financial instruments wh...

item.title: Tell it to SunStar: Shared telco towers - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Tell it to SunStar: Shared telco towers  SunStar Philippines

WE are counting on shared wireless communications towers to help boost internet connectivity all over the country. The immediate beneficiary of new common towers will of course be the third telecommunications player that the government is bringing in precisely to drive competition in the supply of superior internet services. The opening of bids for the would-be third player that will be awarded all the licenses and radio frequency bands needed to compete with PLDT Inc. and Globe Telecom Inc. – the country’s two dominant internet service providers--is Nov. 7. We support every initiative that...

item.title: San Miguel Food and Beverage Inc. to sell shares at ₱85 each - CNN Philippines
item.description:
San Miguel Food and Beverage Inc. to sell shares at ₱85 each  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, October 26) — Amid the struggling stock market environment, diversified conglomerate San Miguel Corporation (SMC) is selling common shares of its food and beverage unit at a fixed price. Shares of the San Miguel Food and Beverage Inc. (FB) will be sold to institutional investors at ₱85.00 each, the company announced in a disclosure to the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE). "This is to advise that SMC shall offer its 400,940,590 common shares in the Company in a secondary sale transaction to institutional investors inclusive of the PSE Trading Participants' share...

item.title: [ANALYSIS] Why is the Philippine stock market now among the world’s worst? - Rappler
item.description:
[ANALYSIS] Why is the Philippine stock market now among the world’s worst?  Rappler

It’s been a tough year for the Philippine economy thus far. Not only is the Philippine peso one of the weakest currencies in ASEAN, but Philippine inflation is also the highest. There is a third way our economy stands out in the region this year: as of last week, the Philippine Stock Exchange Index (PSEI) fell by 18% since the beginning of 2018, becoming the worst-performing stock market in ASEAN. In early October, it actually fared as the world’s worst. Figure 1 shows that the PSEI fell by more than 15.4% from October last year. By contrast, Indonesia’s stock index fell by 2.3% only, while...

item.title: Foreign portfolio investment transactions yield net outflows - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Foreign portfolio investment transactions yield net outflows  SunStar Philippines

REGISTERED investments for the month of September amounted to US$743 million, reflecting a 33.7 percent decrease from the US$1.1 billion figure in August. Likewise, a 42.7 percent year-on-year decline was noted from the US$1.3 billion level recorded during the same month last year. About 85.7 percent of investments registered during the month were listed securities in the Philippine Stock Exchange (pertaining mainly to holding firms, banks, property companies, food, beverage and tobacco firms, and telecommunication companies). The balance went mostly to Peso government securities (GS) (14.3...

item.title: Long-term growth ‘still achievable’ - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Long-term growth ‘still achievable’  SunStar Philippines

THE long-term outlook for the Philippine economy remains positive, amid the economic challenges the country is facing. ATR Asset Management (Atram) Group chief investment officer Phillip Hagedorn yesterday said they see the Philippine economy growing between six and 6.4 percent this year amid global and domestic economic pressures. Hagedorn said despite the downgrade in forecasts by international financial institutions, they are “pretty confident” that the gross domestic product (GDP) will remain high. GDP is a measure of the market value of final goods and services produced. He noted that ...

item.title: Stocks trade flat, peso recovers over lower-than-expected inflation - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stocks trade flat, peso recovers over lower-than-expected inflation  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, October 5) — The peso recovered slightly after successive days of depreciation. The week ended with the peso trading at ₱54.23 versus the greenback, a nine-centavo recovery from Thursday's close of ₱54.32. The stock market also traded flat, losing 15.14 points and closing at 7,078 this week. The services and property sub-indices landed in the green, while the rest remained in the red. Investors, expecting a higher inflation data based on analysts' forecasts, had their appetite for the Philippine market slightly improved by lower inflation values. Inflation, wh...

item.title: How Filipinos can invest in Asia Pacific companies, real estate - CNN Philippines
item.description:
How Filipinos can invest in Asia Pacific companies, real estate  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines) — So you have extra cash to either burn, save or invest. You choose the latter as the idea of growing your money seems to be much wiser. As you search for options, real estate investing may have caught your eye. No, we are not talking about regular houses, but assets called real estate investment trusts - REITs for short. REITs are companies that own a lot of different properties. Some focus on one type of real estate - apartments, hospitals, malls, or office buildings. They make money by collecting rent. Investors can enjoy a steady dividend from REITs as eve...

item.title: Lucio Tan to merge PNB, PNB Savings Bank - Rappler
item.description:
Lucio Tan to merge PNB, PNB Savings Bank  Rappler

MANILA, Philippines – Lucio Tan is merging the Philippine National Bank (PNB) with the PNB Savings Bank to strengthen the Tan group's consumer lending business. Tan disclosed to the Philippine Stock Exchange on Friday,September 28, that PNB's board of directors approved the acquisition of PNB Savings Bank's assets and assumption of its liabilities in exchange for cash. Specifically, the banks, once merged, would have an asset base of P932.7 billion. This is made up of PNB’s total resources at P876.2 billion in end June, along with PNB Savings Bank's P56.5 billion as of end June. The full in...

item.title: Stocks bleed out, peso slumps after inflation data - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stocks bleed out, peso slumps after inflation data  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, September 5) — The day was unkind to the equities and financial markets. The release of the August inflation data, which was at a nine-year low at 6.4 percent, spooked investors into pulling out of the stock and currency markets. The Philippine Stock Exchange lost 1.64 percent on Wednesday, closing at 7,752.27, almost wiping out last week's rally when the market breached past the 7,800 mark. All sub-indices were in the red. The peso was also at a fresh 12-year low at ₱53.55 against the greenback. The peso last hit ₱53.55 on June 29, 2006, and was at ₱53.59 in ...

item.title: PSE to host investment roadshow in Cebu - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
PSE to host investment roadshow in Cebu  SunStar Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange, Inc. (PSE) will host an investment event in Cebu City on Saturday, Sept. 1, from 1 p.m. to 6 p.m. at the Sky Hall of the SM Seaside City dubbed “Achieving Financial Freedom Through Investments.” The event will feature a wide range of today’s most relevant topics, from the latest product offerings of the PSE, tips on investing in a volatile market, to the proposed rules on initial coin offerings of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Resource persons for the talks will come from the PSE, SEC, and the Cebu roadshow partners of the exchange, namely Abac...

item.title: Stock analysts pick top companies to invest in - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stock analysts pick top companies to invest in  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, August 31) — The numbers are in. Twenty-one out of the 30 most actively traded companies, comprising the Philippine Stock Exchange Index (PSEi) posted positive net income growth in the first half. Holding firm LT Group led the advances, with a net income of ₱4.5 billion, or 97% higher from the same period in 2017. Stellar corporate earnings were also delivered by: First Gen Corporation (₱5.9 billion, up 35%), San Miguel Corporation (₱35.5 billion, up 29%), Puregold (₱3.1 billion, up 25%), Globe Telecom (₱9.8 billion, up 21%), and DMCI (₱9.2 billion, up 21%). O...

item.title: Transactions yield $959M in July - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Transactions yield $959M in July  SunStar Philippines

REGISTERED foreign portfolio investments for the month of July 2018 amounted to $959 million, reflecting a 5.3 percent improvement from the $911 million in June. Year-on-year, however, a 33.1-percent decline may be noted from the $1.4 billion level recorded during the previous year. The United States, United Kingdom, Hong Kong, Singapore, and Luxembourg were the top five investor countries for the month, with a combined share to total at 84.8 percent. The bulk of investments registered during the month were in Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE)-listed securities (mainly banks, property compani...

item.title: Hot money flows out as more investors leave stock market - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Hot money flows out as more investors leave stock market  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, August 16) — Foreign portfolio investments, or hot money, continues to be in dire straits. While the latest Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) data recorded more investments in July than in June, it was not enough to make up for the previous month's losses. Hot money as of July was at $959.44 million, a 33.1 percent decline from the $1.4 billion recorded from January to July last year. Net inflows for the month were at $53.29 million, as the $959.44 million in inflows was able to slightly offset $906.15 million in outflows. With June recording a net outflow of ...

item.title: Stock market plunges amid low GDP growth, high inflation - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stock market plunges amid low GDP growth, high inflation  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, August 9) — The stock market was on a bearish mode Thursday in response to disappointing second quarter growth figures. The Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) lost 0.39 percent or 30.75 points to close at 7,820.71. Most sub-indices ended in the red, with mining and oil posting the biggest loss at 38.44 points. Holding firms, financials, and services sub-indeces followed respectively. The industrial and property sub-indices, on the other hand, ended in the green, gaining 34.79 and 3.15 points, respectively. The government announced also on Thursday that the...

item.title: No change in composition of PSE index - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
No change in composition of PSE index  SunStar Philippines

THE Philippine Stock Exchange, Inc. (PSE) announced that there will be no changes in the composition of the 30-member PSE index (PSEi) based on the review made by the exchange covering the period from July 2017 to June 2018. To be included in the PSEi, a listed company should rank among the top companies based on liquidity and full market capitalization. PSEi members as well as sector index members are also required to have a free float level of at least 15 percent. The Financials Index will remain intact but all other sectoral indices will see changes. The recomposition of indices will tak...

item.title: Stock market drops after one-month high finish - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stock market drops after one-month high finish  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 19) — The Philippine Stock Exchange index (PSEi) on Thursday dropped after finishing at a one-month high the previous day. The 30-member PSEi closed at 7,387.87, down by 63.50 points or 0.85 percent from yesterday's 7,451.37--which was the best finish since the 7,414.11 on June 18. READ: Stock market breaches 7,400 point threshold All sub-indices ended in the red, except for services that gained 0.03 percent or 0.40 points. Luis Limlingan of Regina Capital said the PSEi "succumbed to a sell-off after successive days of being bought up," following Federal ...

item.title: Jollibee celebrates 25th listing anniversary - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Jollibee celebrates 25th listing anniversary  SunStar Philippines

Jollibee Foods Corp. (JFC) marked its 25th year as a listed company with a special bell ringing ceremony at the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) on Wednesday. The Jollibee Group now owns and operates 13 domestic and international companies boasting of over 4,000 stores.Shown in the photo are (from left) PSE director Alejandro T. Yu; JFC independent director Monico V. Jacob; JFC director and former Chief Justice Artemio V. Panganiban; Department of Tourism Secretary Bernadette Romulo-Puyat; JFC director Antonio Chua Poe Eng; Jollibee Group Foundation, Inc. president Grace A. Tan Caktiong; JFC...

item.title: RCBC concludes P15-billion stock rights offering - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
RCBC concludes P15-billion stock rights offering  SunStar Philippines

RIZAL Commercial Banking Corp. (RCBC) held a bell ringing ceremony at the Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) to mark the completion of its P15-billion stock rights offering. “Now that the RCBC has further improved its capital ratios through this offering, the bank can now focus even more on its mission of addressing the financial services needs of its clients. While the bank has a wide-range of products and services for the typical commercial and retail segments, it is worth noting that RCBC also developed banking solutions for overseas Filipino workers as well as entrepreneurs with small and ...

item.title: Stock market breaches 7,400 point threshold - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stock market breaches 7,400 point threshold  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 18) — The Philippine stock market continues its recovery from its slump last month. Trading at the Philippine stock exchange closed at 7,451.37 points today, a 0.94 percent change from the 7,381.68 close yesterday. All sub-indices closed in the green, with the property and holdings sub-indices posting the largest gains. Traders mark this point as a break in the 7,400 psychological resistance, and could further encourage trade. "The index traded strongly from the get-go, breaking past the 7,400 psychological resistance early in the morning as it may have d...

item.title: PSE: Companies to continue expansion amid shaky market conditions - CNN Philippines
item.description:
PSE: Companies to continue expansion amid shaky market conditions  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 13) — The stock market closed just shy of the 7,400 point mark on Friday, posting steady recovery over the week. The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) index ended at 7,399 points, 0.66 percent up from the previous day's close. The market opened at 7,225.95 points on Monday as it tried to recover from the one-year low of 6,986.88 points recorded on June 25. PSE President and CEO Ramon Monzon said he expects the market to stay at the 7,200 to the 7,400 level in the coming days. "Probably we'll hover around this area for the next few months unless something ha...

item.title: Peso continues to decline; hot money seeps out - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Peso continues to decline; hot money seeps out  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 12) — The peso continues to weaken. Trading closed at ₱53.5 to $1, which was also the intraday high and was also a mere centavo weaker than yesterday's close. Today's intraday low was ₱53.49 versus the greenback. While the stock market makes a gradual recovery, closing at 7,350.58 today with only the mining and property sub-indices in the red, the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP) reported a continuous pull-out of hot money last month. As of June, foreign portfolio investments (FPI) amount to $306.25 million, with May and June's outflows almost completely...

item.title: Stocks plunge after inflation report - CNN Philippines
item.description:
Stocks plunge after inflation report  CNN Philippines

Metro Manila (CNN Philippines, July 5) — The stock market closed in the red today after inflation for June showed a fresh five-year high. The Philippine Stock Exchange ended trade at 7,233.57 points, a 1.56 percent drop from yesterday's close of 7,348.42 points. This broke the market's four-day winning streak. All sub-indices ended in the red, with holding firms losing the most by 2.09 percent. This was followed by the industrial sector, financials, property, and services respectively. The mining and oil sub-index managed to weather today's blows, losing a mere 0.02 percent. Meanwhile, the ...

item.title: Terms foil Megawide’s plan to work with GMR on Clark airport - SunStar Philippines
item.description:
Terms foil Megawide’s plan to work with GMR on Clark airport  SunStar Philippines

MEGAWIDE CONSTRUCTION CORP. is not yet looking for a new partner for its Clark International Airport project, for which it intends to bid for a 25-year operation and management concession. It was all set to work again with GMR, its partner in upgrading the Mactan-Cebu International Airport, but a new requirement works against the Bangalore-based firm. Terms of the Clark project specify that the airport partner should be on the list of the SkyTrax rating organization’s 20 Best Airports worldwide. In a disclosure last week to the Philippine Stock Exchange, Megawide confirmed that it intends t...
